hanzi-su-wiki:
廊

Значения

Коридор, галерея

Мнемоника

Крытая галерея, навес 广, где мужи 郎 дожидаются приёма государем.

Варианты

廊

láng
corridor; veranda; porch
коридор; веранда; порог
rtega_mnemonic:
廊廊RScorridor, porch, veranda
  • gentleman 郎 walking in his broad 广 corridor or veranda
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 郎 indicates the sound; 广 (wide) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
走廊 [ zǒu láng ]: corridor; aisle; hallway; passageway; veranda
长廊 [ cháng láng ]: promenade; long hallway; Long Corridor in the Summer Palace, Beijing 北京颐和园
画廊 [ huà láng ]: gallery
回廊 [ huí láng ]: winding corridor; cloister; ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
发廊 [ fà láng ]: hair salon; hairdresser's shop; Classifiers: 家

heisig_chinese_memo: A young man plays in the hallway pretending he's exploring a cave.
heisig_constituent: corridor, cave, son, halo, good, drop, silver, city walls
koohiiStory1: Your son plays in the corridor pretending he´s exploring a cave.
koohiiStory2: (ロウ) I think of the corridor found in the cave that Yoda made Luke Skywalker walk through as part of his Jedi training in Empire Strikes Back. It was in this corridor that Luke met Darth Vadar, cut off his head and found himself behind Darth Vadar´s mask. An early little hint that Luke was Darth Vadar´s son.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The canopy guy is a guy who stands in the corridor trying to sell people canopies.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You walk through this corridor every day, and the canopy guy always accosts you with canopy sales. You wish there was another corridor you could take, but it's the only way to get where you want to go.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You take the corridor, but this time the canopy guy is gone. In his place is a new salesman. This one is trying to sell you roe (ろう).
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The roe salesman in the corridor is worse than the canopy salesman. They're both insistent, but the roe salesman smells bad.
Ru_Radicals: 广 (скала с точкой), 邦 (родная страна), 艮 (северо-восток)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the husband (郎) is under the stony cliff (广) in the corridor
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A young man plays in the hallway pretending he's exploring a cave.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " Guang " to " Lang " sound. The original meaning is the gallery house around the main house. "Shuowen Xinfu": "The gallery, the preface to the east and the west. From Guang to Lang Sheng." "Guang Ya. Shigong: "Corridor, She also." Such as "Han Feizi. "Ten Guo": "The people who sit are scattered, and the public is in fear, lying between the corridors." "Han Shu. "Sima Xiangru Biography Part 1": "So it is the Ligong Pavilion, Mishan crosses the valley, high corridor four notes, and re-sitting Qu Pavilion." Yan Shigu notes: "Corridor, surrounding houses under the hall.

The "corridor" of the " corridor temple " means the palace, and the " temple " refers to the ancestral temple. Both are used together to refer to the court. Such as "Shenzi. "Zhizhong": "So the material of the corridor temple, the cover is not the branch of a wood; the pure white fur is not the skin of a fox." "Book of Later Han Dynasty. Biographies of Shen Tugang and Bao Yongzhi: "The general used the commoner as his hometown. The plan for the corridor and temple is undecided. It is unpredictable and unpredictable." Li Xian's note: "The corridor is also the house of the Royal Highness; the temple is also the temple. The affairs of the state must first be found in the temple."

" Lang " by extension means a corridor, that is, a corridor with a roof outside the house. For example, in the Northern Zhou Dynasty Yuxin's "Poems on Painting Screens": "The high pavilion rises from Qianxun, and the promenade has four notes." Du Fu of the Tang Dynasty "The official pavilion of Xiangji Temple in Fucheng County": "The corridor of the courtyard is quiet in spring, and the flying herons are bathed in the evening. "
humanum_short_description_en: From " Guang " to " Lang " sound. The original meaning is the corridor house around the main house, and the extension means corridor.
humanum_full_description:
從「广」，「郎」聲。本義是堂屋四周的廊屋。《說文新附》：「廊，東西序也。从广，郎聲。」《廣雅．釋宮》：「廊，舍也。」如《韓非子．十過》：「坐者散走，平公恐懼，伏于廊室之間。」《漢書．司馬相如傳上》：「於是乎離宮別館，彌山跨谷，高廊四注，重坐曲閣。」顏師古注：「廊，堂下四周屋也。」

　　「廊廟」的「廊」表示宮殿，「廟」指宗廟。兩者連用借指朝廷。如《慎子．知忠》：「故廊廟之材，蓋非一木之枝也；粹白之裘，蓋非一狐之皮也。」《後漢書．申屠剛鮑永郅惲列傳》：「將軍以布衣為鄉里所推，廊廟之計，既不豫定，動軍發眾，又不深料。」李賢注：「廊，殿下屋也；廟，太廟也。國事必先謀於廊廟之所也。」

　　「郎」引申表示走廊，即屋外有頂的過道。如北周庾信〈詠畫屏風詩〉：「高閣千尋起，長廊四注連。」唐代杜甫〈涪城縣香積寺官閣〉：「小院回廊春寂寂，浴鳧飛鷺晚悠悠。」
humanum_short_description: 從「广」，「郎」聲。本義是堂屋四周的廊屋，引申表示走廊。

從「 广 」，「 郎 」聲。本義是堂屋四周的廊屋。《說文新附》：「廊，東西序也。从广，郎聲。」《廣雅．釋宮》：「廊，舍也。」如《韓非子．十過》：「坐者散走，平公恐懼，伏于廊室之間。」《漢書．司馬相如傳上》：「於是乎離宮別館，彌山跨谷，高廊四注，重坐曲閣。」顏師古注：「廊，堂下四周屋也。」 「廊廟」的「 廊 」表示宮殿，「 廟 」指宗廟。兩者連用借指朝廷。如《慎子．知忠》：「故廊廟之材，蓋非一木之枝也；粹白之裘，蓋非一狐之皮也。」《後漢書．申屠剛鮑永郅惲列傳》：「將軍以布衣為鄉里所推，廊廟之計，既不豫定，動軍發眾，又不深料。」李賢注：「廊，殿下屋也；廟，太廟也。國事必先謀於廊廟之所也。」 「 郎 」引申表示走廊，即屋外有頂的過道。如北周庾信〈詠畫屏風詩〉：「高閣千尋起，長廊四注連。」唐代杜甫〈涪城縣香積寺官閣〉：「小院回廊春寂寂，浴鳧飛鷺晚悠悠。」
From " Guang" to " Lang" sound. The original meaning is the gallery house around the main house. "Shuowen Xinfu": "The gallery, the preface to the east and the west. From Guang to Lang Sheng." "Guang Ya. Shigong: "Corridor, She also." Such as "Han Feizi. "Ten Guo": "The people who sit are scattered, and the public is in fear, lying between the corridors." "Han Shu. "Sima Xiangru Biography Part 1": "So it is the Ligong Pavilion, Mishan crosses the valley, high corridor four notes, and re-sitting Qu Pavilion." Yan Shigu notes: "Corridor, surrounding houses under the hall. The "corridor" of the " corridor temple" means the palace, and the " temple" refers to the ancestral temple. Both are used together to refer to the court. Such as "Shenzi. "Zhizhong": "So the material of the corridor temple, the cover is not the branch of a wood; the pure white fur is not the skin of a fox." "Book of Later Han Dynasty. Biographies of Shen Tugang and Bao Yongzhi: "The general used the commoner as his hometown. The plan for the corridor and temple is undecided. It is unpredictable and unpredictable." " Lang" by extension means a corridor, that is, a corridor with a roof outside the house. For example, in the Northern Zhou Dynasty Yuxin's "Poems on Painting Screens": "The high pavilion rises from Qianxun, and the promenade has four notes." 廊字的基本解释

廊
láng
房屋前檐伸出的部分，可避风雨，遮太阳：廊子。前廊后厦。
庑下，殿下外屋：廊庑（堂前廊屋）。
有顶的过道：长廊。走廊。画廊。游廊。

廊字的汉语字典释义

[①]［láng］
［《廣韻》魯當切，平唐，來。］
(1)厅堂周围的屋。
(2)正屋两旁屋檐下面的过道，或有顶的独立通道。如走廊、游廊等。

廊字的英文翻译

◎ 廊
corridor, porch, veranda

廊字的康熙字典解释

【寅集下】【广字部】　廊； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页349第13
【唐韻】魯當切【集韻】【韻會】盧當切【正韻】魯堂切，?音郞。【說文】東西序也。【玉篇】廊，廡下也。【廣韻】殿下外屋也。【前雙竇嬰傳】賜金，?廊廡下。【註】師古曰：廊，堂下周屋也。【揚雄·光祿勳箴】廊殿門闥，限以禁界。　又通作郞。【前漢·董仲舒傳】蓋聞唐虞之時，遊於巖郞之上。【註】晉灼曰：堂邊廡。巖郞，謂嚴峻之郞也。又【司馬相如傳】陛下築郞臺，恐其不高。【註】師古曰：郞堂，下周廂也。

廊字的源字形

廊字的起名意思

有覆盖顶的过道。屋檐下或屋内的过道。

Basic explanation of words
gallery
láng
The protruding part of the front eaves of the house can shelter from wind and rain and shade the sun: the porch. Front porch and back building.
Yuxia, His Highness's Outhouse: Langyu (Tangqian Langwu).
Covered aisle: promenade. corridor. gallery. Veranda.
gallery
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［láng］
["Guangyun" Lu Dangqie, Ping Tang, come. ]
(1) The house around the hall.
(2) Aisles under the eaves on both sides of the main house, or independent passages with roofs. Such as corridors, verandas, etc.

gallery
Name meaning
There are aisles covering the roof. Aisles under the eaves or inside the house.
廊
形声字。广表意,其古文字形体像房屋,表示廊是正房前面两旁的房屋;郎( lang)表声,郎为古代护卫帝王的官,而廊
也有护卫正堂大屋的意思。本义指厢房。现指走廊。
屋檐下的过道或独立有顶的通道:长~|游~「前~后
láng
厦。
~庙 ~檐 ~子 发~ 穿~ 画~ 回~ 走~
廊|廊
галерея
Пиктофонетические символы.
Гуаньи означает, что его древние символы напоминают дома, указывая на то, что коридор - это дома по обе стороны от главного дома; Ланг (lang) выражает звук, Ланг - официальное лицо, охранявшее императора в древние времена, и коридор также имеет значение охраны главного дома.
Первоначальное значение относится к комнате флигеля.
Теперь относится к коридору.
Проходы под карнизами или отдельные крытые переходы: длинное ~ | вы ~ "переднее ~ здание.
~ Храм ~ Карнизы ~ ЗиФа ~ Одежда ~ Живопись ~ Спина ~ Прогулка ~ Галерея | Галерея
láng
1) галерея; коридор; проход
2) веранда, портик, терраса
Radicals: 广, 郎  (canopy, guy)
Meaning Mnemonic
The canopy guy is a guy who stands in the corridor trying to sell people canopies.
You walk through this corridor every day, and the canopy guy always accosts you with canopy sales. You wish there was another corridor you could take, but it's the only way to get where you want to go.
Reading Mnemonic
You take the corridor, but this time the canopy guy is gone. In his place is a new salesman. This one is trying to sell you roe (ろう).
The roe salesman in the corridor is worse than the canopy salesman. They're both insistent, but the roe salesman smells bad.
